mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Rhea, John, 1753-1832
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Believe Mr. Correa passed through Knoxville while self was absent; sends flower of herb which grows in Tennessee; root used for dysentery; glad Jefferson was present when Gen. Jackson arrived at Lynchburg; was not returned to Congress from Tennessee.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1815 November 20, Sullivan Court House, [Blountsville, Sullivan County], Tennessee, to Thomas Jefferson, n.p.
